creditline: Gift of Richard and Beverly Fink
description: abstract image; blue-green rectangle at right with black swirl inside it; orange and light brown slightly curved bars at center; grey slightly curved bar with red and blue marks at bottom center; purple rectangle at left; green and purple swirl with opening at center in ULQ; swirled grey, white, and yellow background with glitter; on graph paper with brown gridlines; received in light-toned wood frame
medium: Color lithograph and screenprint with glitter
text: Frank Stella titled the Exotic Bird series (1977) after endanged or extinct birds such as the Puerto Rican Blue Pigeon, the Okinawa Woodpecker, and Inaccessible Island Rail (a type of rail found only on Inaccessible Island). The compositions were taken from antique drafting templates and tools. All six prints in the series correspond to metal relief paintings. Interesting enough, the prints did not serve as preparatory sketches but were made concurrently to the paintings. The print series was one of the first to incorporate the merging of lithography and screenprinting, a combination of printing techniques the artist would continue to use in later works.
title: Inaccessible Island Rail
